{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.16565v1", "title": "General Duffin--Schaeffer-type counterexamples in diophantine
  approximation", "summary": "Duffin and Schaeffer provided a famous counterexample to show that
Khintchine's theorem fails without monotonicity assumption. Given any
monotonically decreasing approximation function with divergent series, we
construct Duffin--Schaeffer-type counterexamples by restricting the
denominator. We also extend these constructions to the inhomogeneous setting.
Our results resolve some natural questions arising from the works of Erd\H{o}s,
Vaaler, and Yu.", "main_category": "math.NT", "categories": "math.NT", "published": "2025-04-23T09:45:10Z"}
